planets.name: Sun
planets.origin_notes: Across cultures the Sun represents the sustaining animating force of life—Babylonian Šamaš (justice and clarity), Egyptian Ra (creative ordering), Yoruba Orun (ancestral light), and Vedic Surya as atman, the inner spark. Many traditions understood the Sun as relational vitality rather than personal ego.
planets.design_logic: In the Fluid Astrology interface the Sun defines how vitality radiates into the relational space of the spiral, shaping the felt atmosphere rather than defining identity as fixed. It informs luminous shaders, warm palettes, and centered but non-hierarchical emphasis.
planets.queer_theory_links: Connected to the idea of identity as performed illumination (Butler) rather than an essential core. Aligns with queer selfhood as process, becoming, and expressive presence.
planets.project_rationale: Represents selfhood as a moving radiance rather than a static center, mirroring the project's anti-essentialist foundations.

planets.name: Moon
planets.origin_notes: In Mesopotamia, the Moon (Sîn/Nanna) governed time and marked sacred cycles. Afro-Indigenous cosmologies link the Moon to collective memory, ocean tides, and ancestral dreaming. In East Asian symbolism it reflects yin, receptivity, shadows, and inner cycles.
planets.design_logic: Represents inner tides and memory in the UI, influencing slower animations, tides, pulsing light patterns, and atmospheric textures associated with the emotional undercurrent of each layer.
planets.queer_theory_links: Embodies Glissant’s opacity—inner life that does not need to be fully decoded. Resonates with affective epistemologies central to queer and feminist theory, privileging feeling over explanation.
planets.project_rationale: Provides the emotional architecture of the spiral, framing experience as cyclical and relational rather than linear and rational.

planets.name: Mercury
planets.origin_notes: Mercury emerges from Hermes/Thoth traditions of boundary-crossing, translation, and knowledge. In Yoruba cosmology Esu is a messenger trickster navigating crossroads. These liminal figures bridge worlds, languages, and systems.
planets.design_logic: Governs connective logic in the interface—variable mappings, transitions, sentence synthesis—serving as the underlying communication system of Fluid Astrology.
planets.queer_theory_links: Reflects borderlands identity (Anzaldúa), code-switching, transness, and liminal modes of being. Challenges fixed meaning through movement and reinterpretation.
planets.project_rationale: Represents the infrastructural intelligence of the system—how meaning moves, connects, and transforms.

planets.name: Venus
planets.origin_notes: From Inanna and Ishtar to Aphrodite and Oshun, Venus has always been tied to aesthetics as a force that shapes relationality, creativity, erotic power, and cultural expression.
planets.design_logic: Shapes color palettes, softness, gradients, and sensory qualities throughout the UI—Venus determines the aesthetic atmosphere and relational tone.
planets.queer_theory_links: Embodies queer relational ethics—mutuality, joy, chosen family, and desire as world-building (Muñoz). Aesthetics become knowledge rather than decoration.
planets.project_rationale: Grounds the project’s emphasis on beauty as a method—not ornament—supporting emotional engagement and relational understanding.

planets.name: Mars
planets.origin_notes: Mars historically ranges from Roman aggression to Egyptian protection and Indigenous cycles of heat/light. Its meaning is more about activation than violence across cultures.
planets.design_logic: Mars drives movement dynamics—acceleration curves, motion intensity, flare animations, and moments of friction inside the spiral.
planets.queer_theory_links: Reframed as desire-as-catalyst rather than domination, aligning with Preciado’s views on hormonality and embodied activation.
planets.project_rationale: Represents activated change—shifts, impulses, and bursts of passion in how users navigate and interpret the spiral.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.origin_notes: Associated with teachers and cosmic order: Marduk, Zeus, Brihaspati. Many traditions see Jupiter as collective wisdom rather than individual luck.
planets.design_logic: In the interface, Jupiter governs expansiveness—camera distance, open spacing, zoom-out clarity, and the feeling of philosophical breath.
planets.queer_theory_links: Connected to self-invention, community knowledge, and expansive identity politics—growth beyond normative limits.
planets.project_rationale: Provides conceptual spaciousness and meaning-making support throughout the experience.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.origin_notes: Saturn historically embodies both limitation and agricultural order. Your research highlights its connection to timekeeping devices and cosmic boundaries across civilizations.
planets.design_logic: Saturn regulates structural rules—house edges, spiral height increments, temporal logic, and thresholds inside the UI.
planets.queer_theory_links: Resonates with queer temporalities (Halberstam), slow time, and chosen boundaries that produce care rather than punishment.
planets.project_rationale: Represents the discipline of meaning-making—structured but not rigid.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.origin_notes: Although a modern planet, equivalents exist: tricksters, lightning deities, inventors, and breakage spirits across many cultures.
planets.design_logic: Controls surprise elements: sudden transitions, glitch effects, unexpected constellation shifts, and moments of rupture.
planets.queer_theory_links: Reflects queer refusal, glitch feminism (Legacy Russell), and systems-breaking futures.
planets.project_rationale: Adds rupture-as-possibility, enabling new perspectives and unexpected interpretive paths.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.origin_notes: Neptune echoes global oceanic deities—Yemayá, Poseidon, Tangaroa—and is tied to dream cosmologies, mystical transport, and collective unconsciousness.
planets.design_logic: Defines softness: blurs, fog shaders, boundary-diffusion, subtle gradients, and ambiguous transitions.
planets.queer_theory_links: Links to Glissant’s opacity and mystical alternatives to rational knowledge systems.
planets.project_rationale: Softens interpretations, creating space for ambiguity, imagination, and interconnectedness.

planets.name: Pluto
planets.origin_notes: Connected to underworld and rebirth cosmologies: Egyptian Duat, Yoruba Ọ̀run, Mesoamerican Xibalba. These traditions emphasized cyclical renewal, not destruction.
planets.design_logic: Pluto triggers deep zooms, intensity shifts, dark palettes, and transformations in UI state representing moments of inner metamorphosis.
planets.queer_theory_links: Relates to the undoing of the self, shadow integration, and transmutation (Preciado), bringing depth and power work into the interface.
planets.project_rationale: Represents the metamorphic core of the experience—ritualized shedding and renewal.

zodiac_signs.name: Aries
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: In Mesopotamian star-lore Aries was linked to agrarian beginnings and seasonal renewal rather than war. In Egyptian decans it aligns with rising spring spirits. Historically associated with 'first motion' more than aggression.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: In the interface, Aries influences the motion curves of first actions: the spiral entrance animation, the ignition of a house layer, and subtle accelerations. It embodies beginnings.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Relates to queer futurity (Muñoz): the courage to begin, to initiate new worlds and modes of being. The Pioneer becomes a figure of self-invention rather than dominance.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Aries is used to modulate the 'First Gesture' of the user’s chart — how their spiral begins moving.

zodiac_signs.name: Taurus
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Rooted in ancient bull cults (Sumer, Minoan Crete, Indus Valley) symbolizing fertility, embodiment, and earthly abundance. Originally more about life-sustaining materiality than 'materialism.'
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Controls material textures in the UI—stone, moss, earth shimmer. Determines slower transitions, weight, and the grounded feel of certain house layers.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Connected to somatic grounding and body-knowledge (Gloria Anzaldúa, contemporary trans phenomenology). Emphasizes embodiment over abstraction.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Used to create 'embodied stability' in the spiral, shaping the tactile and sensory logic.

zodiac_signs.name: Gemini
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Stems from ancient twin myths—Egyptian, Mayan, and Sumerian—representing complementarity, dialogue, and ambiguity rather than superficiality.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Shapes the logic of variable switching, sentence linking, and the interface's 'breathing' of information. Influences multi-layered tooltips and the weaving of dual meanings.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Resonates strongly with liminal identity, hybridity, code-switching, and nonbinary multiplicity.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Used to generate linguistic multiplicity and layered meaning in the sentence engine.

zodiac_signs.name: Cancer
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Historically associated with the primordial waters, lunar tides, and origins—not domesticity. Connected to the Egyptian scarab cycle (rebirth) through summer solstice symbolism.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Controls inner-radius shading, emotional frequency of animations, and softer textures. Influences house foundations and 'rooting' logic.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Aligns with queer kinship, chosen family, and emotional labor as world-building.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Helps define the emotional architecture of the spiral—soft edges, tides, and memory-flow.

zodiac_signs.name: Leo
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Solar symbolism spans Egypt (Sekhmet/Bastet), Persia, Mali, and the ancient Near East. Leo originally represented the heart of summer and artistic ritual.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Shapes spotlight animations, radiant fractals, celebration gradients, and the expressive feel of child-like creative motion inside House 5.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Aligned with queer performance, drag, self-display, radiance as identity, and communal joy.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Supports expressive visuals and the centrality of play within the interface.

zodiac_signs.name: Virgo
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Originally a grain goddess (Shala, Demeter), tying Virgo to agriculture, healing, and caretaking crafts rather than perfectionism.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Controls structural clarity, pixel-level precision, micro-animations, and healing/repair motifs in UI flow.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Reflects care work, community work, and activist labor—central to queer and feminist praxis.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Governs refinement and service logics—how meaning is cared for inside the system.

zodiac_signs.name: Libra
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Linked to Egyptian Ma’at (cosmic balance), Hellenistic legal symbolism, and broader cross-cultural ethics of equilibrium.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Shapes symmetry, visual balance, harmonic spacing, and the 'mirroring' logic in house transitions.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Connects to relational ethics, consent, mutuality, and co-created meaning.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Supports partnership and co-creation metaphors in the interface.

zodiac_signs.name: Scorpio
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Derived from ancient underworld initiation rites. Early Scorpio was about sacred descent, not fear. Includes Mesoamerican and Egyptian subterranean cosmologies.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Controls depth-of-field changes, shadow work, and intensity gradients. Governs metaphorical 'descent' sequences.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Relates to queer trauma work, shadow integration, deep desire, and the power of vulnerability.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Represents depth processes and transformations inside the chart experience.

zodiac_signs.name: Sagittarius
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Ancient archer figures symbolize philosophical search: Sumerian Centaur-like guardians, Greek Chiron, Turkic sky-archers, and nomadic spiritual travelers.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Controls zoom-outs, horizon expansions, philosophical overlays, and moments of 'seeking' in the interface.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Connects to queer futurity, world-traveling (Lugones), and identity as expansive exploration.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Defines spaces of exploration, insight, and the chart’s philosophical arcs.

zodiac_signs.name: Capricorn
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Capricorn’s roots lie in Babylonian sea-goat myths—creatures connecting land and deep waters—symbolizing mastery of thresholds, not authoritarianism.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Controls the vertical progression of the spiral, structural scaffolding, and high-clarity thresholds (peaks, goals, public achievement).
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Related to queer resilience, endurance, and reimagining legacy outside heteronormative success narratives.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Creates the architecture of mastery and commitment inside the experiential journey.

zodiac_signs.name: Aquarius
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Connected to ancient water-bearer myths (Egyptian Hapi, Babylonian Ea) symbolizing knowledge distribution, not cold detachment.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Controls glitch effects, future-facing animations, constellation logic, and visual innovation.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Highly linked to queer futurism, collective dreaming, and radical imagination.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Defines the interface’s innovative and community-oriented dimension.

zodiac_signs.name: Pisces
zodiac_signs.origin_notes: Rooted in ancient fish-goddess myths (Atargatis) and oceanic spiritualities. Symbolizes permeability and dreamstates across many cultures.
zodiac_signs.design_logic: Defines blur, fog, softness, ambiguity, and the dreamlike transitions across the UI.
zodiac_signs.queer_theory_links: Expresses queer opacity, porous identity, and mystical interconnection.
zodiac_signs.project_rationale: Softens boundaries and creates imaginal, liminal experiences across the spiral.

houses.name: House of Emergence & Self-Projection
houses.essence: Identity, self-expression, how you begin things
houses.origin_notes: Historically tied to the Ascendant and the horizon line, the 1st house was seen as the place where the sky rises into visibility. It is less about fixed personality and more about how a being comes into view, how life steps over a threshold.
houses.design_logic: In the spiral, this house anchors the top of the coil and the direction of first movement. It modulates the initial camera approach, the way glyphs phase in, and the quality of that very first impression of the chart.
houses.queer_theory_links: Resonates with self-fashioning rather than 'true self' discovery: identity as performed, emergent, and re-staged over time rather than discovered as an essence.
crosscultural_resonances: Hellenistic focus on the Ascendant as 'hour-marker' of embodiment
Vedantic emphasis on the lagna as the vehicle the soul uses
Indigenous and Afro-diasporic ideas of first naming and appearance in community
houses.project_rationale: Used as a lens for how the user 'arrives' in the interface: the pacing of the welcome, the first sentence tone, the way their spiral reveals itself as a gesture of emergence.

houses.name: House of Grounding & Material Flow
houses.origin_notes: Traditionally associated with movable goods and survival resources rather than just money. Many cultures tie this zone to reciprocity, land, and sustenance, not only personal wealth.
houses.design_logic: Governs density, weight, and tactile textures in the interface: the more 2nd-house emphasis, the more the visuals lean into stone, soil, and slow gradients instead of abstract light.
houses.queer_theory_links: Speaks to economic precarity, chosen forms of sustenance, and alternative value systems beyond heteronormative success metrics. What is worthy, what is enough, and who gets to decide.
crosscultural_resonances: Agricultural cosmologies linking value to harvest and soil
Commons-based traditions where land and water are shared
Craft and guild lineages where skill is a key resource
houses.project_rationale: Used to shape how the system talks about 'value' without moralizing it, and how it visually represents stability, grounding, and material flow in the spiral.

houses.name: House of Mental Curiosity & Communication
houses.origin_notes: Originally linked with neighboring lands, messengers, letters, and siblings. This house is about close-range networks and daily exchanges, not just 'small talk.'
houses.design_logic: Shapes how micro-transitions, tooltips, and sentence connections behave. It influences the 'chattiness' of the interface and how quickly or playfully information appears.
houses.queer_theory_links: Relates to code-switching, language play, meme culture, and everyday micro-politics of speech. It holds the textures of how queer and marginalised people learn to speak and be understood.
crosscultural_resonances: Mercury and trickster figures across mythologies
Oral storytelling cultures centered on kin and neighbors
houses.project_rationale: Used to design the conversational and educational tone of the text engine and how 'nearby' ideas link across the spiral.

houses.name: House of Inner Rooting & Emotional Foundation
houses.origin_notes: In many traditions this house is the underground root of the chart: ancestors, land-connection, and the unseen base of life. It is not just domesticity but deep emplacement.
houses.design_logic: Controls the darkest, most interior gradients around the base of the spiral and the feeling of 'inside' vs 'outside.' It affects how background imagery layers in when the user explores emotional or ancestral themes.
houses.queer_theory_links: Intersects with chosen family, diaspora, migration, and the work of building home when biological or national homes are unsafe. Home here is imagined as practice, not property.
crosscultural_resonances: Ancestor veneration across African, Asian, and Indigenous lineages
Latin American and Caribbean understandings of casa as extended kinship space
Notions of spiritual home and shrine in multiple traditions
houses.project_rationale: Used to frame the project’s relationship to ancestry and grounding without reproducing rigid family norms.

houses.name: House of Expressive Joy & Inner Child
houses.origin_notes: Historically tied to festivals, performance, art, and the joys and risks of visibility. It concerns delight and creative risk more than 'just dating' or literal children.
houses.design_logic: Drives playful animations, bright color flares, confetti-like particles, and the sense that parts of the interface are 'performing back' to the user.
houses.queer_theory_links: Connected to queer joy, camp, drag, flirting with possibility, and recovering a sense of play after constraint.
crosscultural_resonances: Ritual theatre and sacred play across cultures
Communal dance and music as forms of resistance
houses.project_rationale: Used to justify moments of visual excess and experimentation: the interface is allowed to be playful, not purely explanatory.

houses.name: House of Purposeful Work & Craft
houses.origin_notes: Once associated with labor, servants, illness, and the unglamorous maintenance of life. It is about systems of care, labor, and bodily rhythm.
houses.design_logic: Shapes how repetitive animations, grids, and background systems run. It governs the invisible 'maintenance' logic of the interface: what quietly keeps things functioning.
houses.queer_theory_links: Relates to care work, mutual aid, disability justice, and the everyday labor that sustains communities but is often devalued.
crosscultural_resonances: Monastic daily rituals of service and craft
Traditional healing practices and small-scale care
houses.project_rationale: Used to narrate work and habit as craft, not grind, and to hold space for health without moralizing wellness.

houses.name: House of Relational Harmony & Partnership
houses.origin_notes: Traditionally the house of open others: allies, adversaries, contracts. It is the mirror zone where self meets counterpart, not only romantic pairings.
houses.design_logic: Controls mirroring effects, reflections, and symmetric layouts. It also affects how two nodes are visually linked or balanced in the interface.
houses.queer_theory_links: Speaks to non-normative relationship structures, polyamory, queer kin, and the ethics of reciprocity and consent rather than just formalized couples.
crosscultural_resonances: Ritualized forms of alliance and treaty
houses.project_rationale: Used to frame relational dynamics in the chart without assuming hetero monogamy; focuses on the mirror function of the 'other.'

houses.name: House of Deep Transformation & Shared Resources
houses.origin_notes: Historically linked with death rites, inheritances, and taboo subjects. It is where what is shared, hidden, or merged demands a different level of honesty.
houses.design_logic: Controls more dramatic lighting shifts, underworld-inspired gradients, and the 'depth' feeling in certain camera dives within the spiral.
houses.queer_theory_links: Intersects with trauma processing, survivorship, erotic power, and the politics of sharing resources under marginal conditions.
houses.project_rationale: Used to legitimize intensity and shadow work in the system: not everything has to be soft or 'easy' to be meaningful.

houses.name: House of Expansive Wisdom & Philosophy
houses.origin_notes: Traditionally associated with foreign lands, big questions, law, and theology. It concerns how meaning and worldview scale beyond the local.
houses.design_logic: Shapes the largest zoom-outs, horizon-like backgrounds, and the tone of big-picture textual synthesis in the interface.
houses.queer_theory_links: Aligned with decolonial thinking, border-crossing, and speculative futures that question dominant belief structures.
crosscultural_resonances: Legal and ethical frameworks from multiple civilizations
houses.project_rationale: Used to modulate the 'philosophical altitude' of the system: when it zooms out and reflects on patterns rather than details.

houses.name: House of Mastery & Public Achievement
houses.origin_notes: Originally connected to public visibility, responsibility, and high places (literal and symbolic). It is about what becomes visible on the societal stage.
houses.design_logic: Controls summit-like camera positions, vertical hierarchies in the UI, and the visual weight of titles, headers, and public-facing statements.
houses.queer_theory_links: Intersects with performing identity in public, navigating institutions, and redefining what a 'legacy' looks like outside normative paths.
crosscultural_resonances: Royal courts and advisory roles across cultures
Artistic or spiritual renown instead of corporate status
houses.project_rationale: Used to reframe visibility as responsibility and contribution, not only status, in how the interface speaks about 'success.'

houses.name: House of Collective Vision & Innovation
houses.origin_notes: Traditionally associated with allies, patrons, movements, and shared hopes. It is the space of networks and shared futures.
houses.design_logic: Shapes network visualizations, constellation webs, and clustered node arrangements. It governs how the interface shows 'many' together.
houses.queer_theory_links: Deeply related to queer collectivities, activist networks, online communities, and shared utopian projects.
houses.project_rationale: Used as the backbone for the constellation view and any collaboration or sharing metaphors in the experience.

houses.name: House of Spiritual Dissolving & Compassion
houses.origin_notes: Historically linked with retreat, enclosure, and the invisible: monasteries, exile, dreams, and the places where one is removed from ordinary life.
houses.design_logic: Controls fog, blur, low-contrast overlays, and the feeling of edges softening. It often governs the final transitions in the spiral journey.
houses.queer_theory_links: Speaks to invisibility, closet and post-closet life, mystical states, and forms of inner life that do not easily translate into public language.
crosscultural_resonances: Mystical currents across multiple religions and folk traditions
houses.project_rationale: Used to hold the most liminal and contemplative parts of the interface—where the system goes quiet and invites slower reflection.

aspects.name: Conjunction
aspects.essence: Two planets merging energies in the same space

aspects.name: Square
aspects.essence: Dynamic friction requiring growth and action

view_modes.name: Spiral View
view_modes.description: Overview mode showing the full helical spiral structure with all 12 house layers
view_modes.purpose: See the holistic chart structure and navigate between houses

view_modes.name: House Layer View
view_modes.description: Focused view of a single house layer with its planets and zodiac sign
view_modes.purpose: Explore a specific house's themes and planetary placements

view_modes.name: Planet View
view_modes.description: Intimate view of a single planet with detailed interpretations
view_modes.purpose: Deep dive into a planet's archetypal meaning and placement

view_modes.name: Constellation View
view_modes.description: Aspect-focused view showing planetary connections as a constellation
view_modes.purpose: Visualize and explore the aspect patterns in the chart

view_modes.name: Flat View
view_modes.description: Top-down perspective of the spiral, flattened to show all houses at once
view_modes.purpose: See the chart from a mandala-like perspective

view_modes.name: Funnel View
view_modes.description: Default vertical helical view with houses descending from top to bottom
view_modes.purpose: Navigate the chart as a journey from House 1 to House 12

interface_concepts.description: Poetic name representing the blending of house and sign qualities
The symbolic character embodying a planet's essence
Life arena or domain where planetary energies express
The boundary or threshold between two houses/signs
interface_concepts.context: Planets near cusps blend qualities of adjacent houses

interface_concepts.description: The allowable degree range for an aspect to be considered active
interface_concepts.context: Different aspects have different orbs (e.g., conjunction: 10°, sextile: 6°)

interface_concepts.description: Cinematic camera movement gliding through multiple house layers
interface_concepts.context: Used when navigating between non-adjacent houses

interface_concepts.description: Floating poetic phrases within each house layer
interface_concepts.context: Contextual sentences that change based on view mode

interface_concepts.description: Non-deterministic, relational approach emphasizing archetypal fluidity over fixed meanings
interface_concepts.philosophy: Anti-essentialist, honors cultural origins, avoids prediction

technical_terms.description: The 3D spiral structure with 12 layers representing the houses
technical_terms.technical_detail: Grows from radius 2.5 to 5.5, height 26 units

technical_terms.description: A planet's position measured in degrees around the 360° zodiac wheel
technical_terms.context: Used to determine house placement and aspects

technical_terms.description: Quality of action: Cardinal (initiating), Fixed (sustaining), or Mutable (adapting)
Yang (active, masculine) or Yin (receptive, feminine) energy
The zodiac sign rising on the eastern horizon at birth; marks the 1st house cusp
A map of planetary positions at the exact moment and location of birth

poetic_vocabulary.usage: Core quality or nature of a planet, sign, or house
Taking physical or energetic form; manifesting
Transformation from one state to another

user_notes.instructions: Add your own definitions, interpretations, or notes in the 'user_definition' fields above. This glossary is yours to personalize and expand.
future_features: In-app glossary panel accessible via button
Link glossary terms to related chart placements
